patterns: calculate budget the budget from {city} to {city} by{vechile}
Show me places to eat in {city}
responses: You might want to check out these places in {city}: {data}

places_to_visit.name: Meenakshi Amman Temple, Madurai
places_to_visit.description: One of the most famous temples in India, dedicated to Goddess Meenakshi (Parvati) and Lord Sundareswarar (Shiva). Known for its intricate architecture and towering gopurams adorned with thousands of colorful sculptures, this temple is a marvel of Dravidian architecture.

places_to_visit.name: Brihadeeswarar Temple, Thanjavur
places_to_visit.description: Also known as the Big Temple, this UNESCO World Heritage Site is dedicated to Lord Shiva and is an architectural masterpiece built by the Chola dynasty. The massive Nandi statue and the towering vimana (temple tower) are highlights of this ancient temple.

places_to_visit.name: Ramanathaswamy Temple, Rameswaram
places_to_visit.description: This temple is one of the twelve Jyotirlinga temples dedicated to Lord Shiva and is part of the Char Dham pilgrimage. Famous for its longest corridor among Hindu temples, it is a place of deep spiritual significance in Hindu mythology.

places_to_visit.name: Sri Ranganathaswamy Temple, Srirangam
places_to_visit.description: This temple is one of the twelve Jyotirlinga temples dedicated to Lord Shiva and is part of the Char Dham pilgrimage. Famous for its longest corridor among Hindu temples, it is a place of deep spiritual significance in Hindu mythology.

places_to_visit.name: Kanchi Kailasanathar Temple, Kanchipuram
places_to_visit.description: This ancient temple, dedicated to Lord Shiva, is the oldest structure in Kanchipuram and is famous for its unique architecture and beautiful sandstone carvings. It is a peaceful place, reflecting the grandeur of the Pallava dynasty.

places_to_visit.name: Annamalaiyar Temple, Tiruvannamalai
places_to_visit.description: Dedicated to Lord Shiva, this temple is associated with the sacred Annamalai Hill and is an important site for the Karthigai Deepam festival. The temple has grand gopurams and is known for the Girivalam (circumambulation) ritual around the hill.

places_to_visit.name: Nataraja Temple, Chidambaram
places_to_visit.description: This temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva in his form as Nataraja, the cosmic dancer. Known for its depiction of the Chidambara Rahasya (a hidden representation of the divine), the temple is an important pilgrimage center for Shaivites and a symbol of Tamil architecture and culture.

places_to_visit.name: Jambukeswarar Temple, Thiruvanaikaval
places_to_visit.description: Situated near Tiruchirappalli, this temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva as Jambukeswarar and represents the element of water. Built by the Cholas, it is one of the five Pancha Bhoota Sthalas, representing the five elements of nature.

places_to_visit.name: Kumari Amman Temple, Kanyakumari
places_to_visit.description: Located at the southern tip of India, this temple is dedicated to Goddess Kanya Kumari (Parvati in her virgin form). The temple is beautifully situated with views of the confluence of the Bay of Bengal, the Indian Ocean, and the Arabian Sea.

places_to_visit.name: Murugan Temple, Palani
places_to_visit.description: One of the six abodes of Lord Murugan, Palani is a popular pilgrimage destination. Located atop a hill, the temple is known for its divine ambiance and is associated with the Dhandayuthapani Swamy, a form of Lord Murugan.

places_to_visit.name: Srivilliputhur Andal Temple, Srivilliputhur
places_to_visit.description: This temple is dedicated to Goddess Andal, one of the twelve Alvars and a prominent figure in Vaishnavism. The temple tower is featured on the Tamil Nadu state emblem, and it is known for its towering gopuram and spiritual significance.

places_to_visit.name: Ekambareswarar Temple, Kanchipuram
places_to_visit.description: Another significant temple in Kanchipuram, dedicated to Lord Shiva. It is part of the Pancha Bhoota Stalams and represents the element of earth. The massive temple complex and the ancient mango tree within the premises add to its uniqueness.

places_to_visit.name: Thillai Nataraja Temple, Chidambaram
places_to_visit.description: This unique temple in Chidambaram is famous for the Chidambaram Rahasya and is dedicated to Shiva in the form of Nataraja, symbolizing the cosmic dance. The temple is also famous for its connection to classical dance forms like Bharatanatyam.
